p: Four new, previously unknown structures have been isolated from A. absinthium herb by Javed et al.; they were glycosidic esters: 3,11-dimethyldodecan-1,7-dioic acid-1- β-D-glucopyranosyl-6′-octadec-9′′-enoate, lanost-24-en-3 β-ol-11-one-28-oic acid-21,23 α-olide-3 β-D-glucopyranosyl-2′-dihydrocaffeoate-6′-decanoate, stigmast-5,22-dien-3 β -ol-21-oic acid-3 β-glucopyranosyl-2′-octadec-9′′-enoate, and tricosan-14-on-1,4-olide-5-eicos-9′-enoate. The authors classified the first two compounds as sterols, while the other two compounds could not be classified into a specific group of metabolites [ 40].
